sn35.62:1.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the principle for depleting all fuel.
sn35.62:1.3: And what is the principle for depleting all fuel?
sn35.62:2.2: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:4.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.62:6.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.62:6.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.62:12.1: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:14.9: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:16.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.62:18.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.62:18.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.62:20.1: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.
sn35.62:20.2: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.62:20.3: They grow disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.62:20.4: They grow disillusioned with the mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and mind contact.
sn35.62:20.5: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
sn35.62:20.6: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.62:20.7: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn35.62:20.8: This is the principle for depleting all fuel.”
